Class dom.session.Closure 

java.lang.Object
    |
    +----dom.session.Closure
public class Closure
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
Class to represent an arbitrary closure, or code block. Uses CRAPI to do things like a) get a String name for a given class; b) getting a Class object for a given name; c) given an array of Objects that represent the parameter values for the Closure, get the types of those objects; d) look for a given Method (with given Class, String methodName, and array of Object parameters), on a target object (provided at execution time). TODO: Doesn't currently search inheritance hierarchy to execute a given Closure...Let's see if that's necessary.

Author:
Scott Lewis
Source Code:
Closure.java

Closure

public Closure()

public Closure(java.lang.Class aClass,
               java.lang.String methodName,
               java.lang.Object[] args)
Normal constructor
Parameters:
aClass - the class that has the code block to execute
methodName - the method name to execute
args - the array of object arguments for this closure

Closure

public Closure(java.lang.String className,
               java.lang.String methodName,
               java.lang.Object[] args)
Alternative constructor. Takes class name as string.
Parameters:
className - the fully qualified name of the class (e.g. java.util.Vector)
methodName - the methodName to invoke on the desired class
args - the array of Object arguments to pass to the block on invokation
Method Detail

getClassForName

public static java.lang.Class getClassForName(java.lang.String name) throws java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
Utility method for Closure class to get the Class object for a given fully-qualified classname (e.g. java.util.Vector)
Parameters:
name - the class name to get
Returns:
Class the class found corresponding to this name. Will use whatever classloader was used to load this Closure class. Returns null if name is null.
Throws:
java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - thrown if class not found

getNameForClass

public static java.lang.String getNameForClass(java.lang.Class clazz)
Utility method for Closure class to get the fully qualified class name for a given Class object.
Parameters:
clazz - the Class object to get the name for
Returns:
String the fully qualified name for the class

getArgTypesFromArgs

public static java.lang.Class[] getArgTypesFromArgs(java.lang.Object[] args)
Utility methods to get an array of Class representing the object types for our arguments.
Parameters:
args - an array of objects that are the arguments.
Returns:
Class[] the array of class object that represent the arg *types* for the provided args.

findMethodOnClass

public static java.lang.reflect.Method findMethodOnClass(java.lang.Class theClass,
                                       java.lang.String methName,
                                       java.lang.Class[] argTypes)
Utility to find a method on this object with a given method name and set of argument types. Doesn't currently do search on superclasses, this will be added if required.
Parameters:
theClass - the class to look on
methName - a String representation of a method name (case sensitive)
args - an Object array containing the object types for the parameters of the desired method
Returns:
Method the Method object representing the method found. Returns null if no matching method found on this object.

findMethodOnClassRecursive

public static java.lang.reflect.Method findMethodOnClassRecursive(java.lang.Class theClass,
                                                java.lang.String methName,
                                                java.lang.Class[] argTypes)
Given a starting class (first parameter), search the entire superclass chain for a method with the given name and with the same arity as the argTypes array parameter.
Parameters:
theClass - the leaf class to start searching from
methName - the method name of the method to find
argTypes - the Class [] to use to find a method (only uses arity) to do search

searchForTarget

public static java.lang.reflect.Method searchForTarget(java.lang.reflect.Method[] arr,
                                     java.lang.String methName,
                                     java.lang.Class[] argTypes)
Search given array of Method objects (first param) for the first one with the (second param) given method name and the same *arity* as the (third param) given array of types.
Parameters:
arr - a Method array to search
methName - the String method name of the method to search for
Returns:
Method the first method instance found in arr that meets the given search criteria. Returns null if no matching method found.

obj - the Object to put into array at position 0
Returns:
Object[] containing one element in array

checkParamsForSerializable

public static void checkParamsForSerializable(Closure closure) throws java.io.NotSerializableException
Check the given closure to verify that the arguments are all all Serializable. If not, this will throw a NotSerializableException
Parameters:
closure - the Closure to check out
Throws:
java.io.NotSerializableException - thrown if any one of the parameters of the given Closure do not implement Serializable

getArgTypes

protected java.lang.Class[] getArgTypes()
Get arg types for our arguments.
Returns:
Class[] the array of class objects that represent the arg *types* for this object's args.

findMethodForClosure

protected java.lang.reflect.Method findMethodForClosure(java.lang.Class aClass) throws java.lang.Exception
Find the method object corresponding to our closure. Calls getDeclaredMethod on class corresponding to the class name provided for this closure.
Parameters:
aClass - the Class of the target object.
Returns:
Method the method object found (if any) using CRAPI
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - thrown if class not found, or desired method not found

findMethodForClosureRecursive

protected java.lang.reflect.Method findMethodForClosureRecursive(java.lang.Class aClass) throws java.lang.Exception
Find the method object corresponding to our closure. Calls getDeclaredMethod on class corresponding to the class name provided for this closure. This version recursively looks on the given class and all of that class's superclasses.
Parameters:
aClass - the Class of the target object.
Returns:
Method the method object found (if any) using CRAPI
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - thrown if class not found, or desired method not found

coerceTarget

protected java.lang.Object coerceTarget(java.lang.Object target,
                              java.lang.reflect.Method toExecute) throws java.lang.Exception
Coerce the target object for the given method in any way desired.
Parameters:
target - the Object that the Method will be invoked on
toExecute - the Method to invoke
Returns:
Object that represents the target object after coersion
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - thrown if any problems coercing the target

coerceArgs

protected java.lang.Object[] coerceArgs() throws java.lang.Exception
Coerce the arguments for this Closure.
Returns:
Object [] that is the coerced version of the arguments for this Closure
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - thrown if some problem doing coersion

executeThisClosure

public final void executeThisClosure(java.lang.Object target) throws java.lang.Exception
Method to actually execute this closure on the given target Object. This method is declared final as subclasses should always use this method to execute themselves on a given target object.
Parameters:
target - the Object to execute this Closure on
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - thrown if some problem invoking method on given target.
See Also:
invoke
